Description: Both models identify unauthorized access as a critical threat due to weak authentication mechanisms.
Both models recommend data encryption as a mitigation strategy to prevent data leakage.
Both models highlight code injection as a significant threat due to unsanitized inputs.
Denial of Service (DoS) attacks are identified as a common threat across both models.
Both models emphasize the need for token expiration and management to prevent replay attacks.
Both models align with GDPR requirements regarding data protection and user privacy.
Both models recommend regular updates and patch management to mitigate privilege escalation vulnerabilities.
Improper input validation is a common threat identified in both models, leading to various attacks.
Both models can benefit from a unified incident response strategy to address identified threats.
Both models identify replay attacks as a significant threat due to potential weaknesses in token management.
